author: {'steamid': '76561197971988034', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1585016594}
review:
Just wanted to say I love the look and feel of the game. Reminds me of Warcraft 1: Orcs vs Humans, and Dune. Maybe that's why the small UI and pathfinding issues don't bother me.

Open world is definitely interesting. Looking forward to more updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033126166', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1583747507}
review:
The Game looks so lovely and well designed. But its been 5 months now since the last patch/update was announced. The game really needs some improvements and bug fixing overall. Mostly pathfinding


I hope the Developer comes back and starts working on some patches again.
developer_response:
Hey, the next patch has indeed been a long time in the making, since it tackles some big technical debt in the engine that needs to be repaid on the road to release. 
The previous update was in January, but it was strictly bug-fixes so I felt it only warranted a minor update status: https://steamcommunity.com/gid/103582791464658008/announcements/detail/3618013995800848253
I'm hard at work on the new update and hope to have it ready sometime in the next week. Hope you'll check back soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011407387', 'num_games_owned': 896, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1583587423}
review:
As described by the author this is a game under development hence my expectations are as such. There will be features missing but the development feels really active and patches and larger updates roll out with regular intervals. 

With that said Trollskog as of this date depicts a cosy and warm atmosphere. The tempo of which you grow your villages, doing quests and explore the map is so comfortable and you are really able to set your own pace of gameplay which is quite unique for an RTS game. It's similar to other colony sim games like banished but instead of pure survival it leans more towards an RPG in my opinion. 

Personally I'll look forward to following the development of this game and I feel its a game you will return as new content and patches are released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198274332666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1639504989}
review:
This is the first Early Access game I've ever bought. I just couldn't resist the cute graphics and the title Trollskog (pronounce Trollskoog; means Trollforest).

At this time the tutorial does no handholding whatsoever. Trial and error is the way to go. But having played tons of builder sims during my time on earth some things just comes natural. Though it wouldn't hurt with an ingame FAQ once the game is ready to leave EA.

The music is really nice, though it does stop after a while. Loop please.
The minimap is far too dark.
I did not run into any bugs (as far as I know). Though one quest is causing confusion atm. Deliver food to a troll. A villager carrying food gets stuck in walking mode near the troll. 

The ONE thing I really would like right now is for the resolution settings to be adjusted to work well with OBS streaming app. The game is not centered properly in the allocated window space. It's set in the upper left corner with alot of black space to the far right and bottom. I SOOOO want to stream this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011332245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1580057423}
review: A fun and relaxing game that is easy to get into, fun to explore  and will draw you into its world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003050439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1578154956}
review: The Devs really need to communicate better with everyone lately the Devs haven't done anything to fix the bugs or the path finding issues. I like this game a lot however there are still so many bugs It's taking the fun out of playing It. I understand that the Devs were on vacation but why so long when the is unplayable In It's current state. These issues like the path finding should have been fixed ASAP before going on vacation.  I'm sorry but I can't recommend this game to anyone until the path finding problems get fixed. This is a poor excuse of a game when the path finding should have been fixed before being released to everyone to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062090701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1644144694}
review: Built a bakery, cannot set a drop off point...what the hell. Maybe if the developer fixed the first part of the game, it could be enjoyable. I refunded
developer_response:
Hey! Just chiming in for anyone else experiencing this issue: since the latest patch, buildings need to be connected by road to the town hall before they can haul resources. 
This is a new feature, so unfortunately the UI explaining this mechanic is not in yet. Hope to patch it this weekend to prevent any further confusion.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972270839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1573567987}

author: {'steamid': '76561198134146269', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1570090147}
review:
[h1]Einleitung[/h1]

Bei Trollskog handelt es sich um ein klassisches Aufbaustrategie Spiel. Wie üblich errichtet man eine Siedlung, baut Rohstoffe ab und kämpft gegen feindliche Einheiten. Das Spiel befindet sich noch in einem frühen Entwicklungsstadium und enthält entsprechend noch nicht alle Funktionen.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

Zu Beginn des Spiels gilt es ein erstes Dorfzentrum zu errichten. Dabei behilflich ist ein weißer Vogel, dieser vergibt erste Missionen, welche als Tutorial verstanden werden können. Für das Erfüllen dieser Mission erhält man ein paar Goldmünzen welche unseren Reichtum mehren und für Rohstoffe ausgegeben werden können.

Nachdem Basisrohstoffe wie Holz und Lebensmittel abgebaut wurden, kann, dass Dorfzentrum mit weiteren Gebäuden erweitert werden. Wohnhäuser ermöglichen nicht nur das Ausbilden weiterer Arbeiter. Vielmehr sind sie notwendig, weil nur Wohnhäuser mit Äckern erweitert werden können. Es reicht allerdings nicht aus auszuwählen was denn angebaut werden soll, auch muss immer mindestens ein Arbeiter zugewiesen werden.

Schon nach kurzer Zeit können z.B. Seile hergestellt werden. Dies schaltet die zweite Gebäudestufe frei, bestehende Gebäude können entsprechend aufgewertet werden. Dies verändert nicht nur die Optik, auch kann z.B. das Wohnhaus um ein zweites Feld erweitert werden.

Nun wird es langsam Zeit, Kämpfer auszubilden und dem Vogel, vom Anfang des Spiels, in den Wald zu folgen. Dort angekommen gilt es eine Silbererzmine zu erobern und sogleich ein weiteres Dorfzentrum zu errichten. So erweitert man, mit Hilfe von Siedlern, sein kleines Mittelalterreich immer weiter. Auf der Karte trifft man auf weitere Questgeber und muss so diverse Aufgaben erfüllen.

[h1]Kurzinfo[/h1]

[b]Positiv[/b]
[b]+[/b] Mittelalter im schedischen Stil
[b]+[/b] einfaches Spielprinzip
[b]+[/b] ständige Weiterentwicklung

[b]Negativ[/b]
[b]-[/b] alles schon mal da gewesen
[b]-[/b] bisher zu wenig Umfang (Early Access)

[h1]Wertung[/h1]
[*][b]Musik/Sound: 5/10[/b]
Musik und Sound sind ausrreichend und passen gut zum Setting des Spiels, Wunder darf man allerdings nicht erwarten.[/list]
[*][b]Grafik 6/10[/b]
Die Grafik ist ausreichend und Übersichtlich. Die Spielwelt könnte lebendiger wirken, im Dorf bewegt sich aber immer etwas.[/list]
[*][b]Spielspaß 7/10[/b]
Für Fans des Genres ist Trollskog auf jeden Fall einen Blick wert. Alle anderen sollten sich vor dem Kauf ein paar Videos anschauen![/list]

[h1]30 Minuten Review[/h1]
https://youtu.be/XDc8IyIdDWM
[h1]Fazit[/h1]

Bisher bietet Trollskog nicht genug Inhalt, um seinen Preis zu rechtfertigen. Kommen aber noch die versprochenen Inhalte hinzu dürfte es sich um ein solides Spiel mit einem guten Preisleistungsverhältnis handeln. Dies, in Verbindung mit dem bisher gebotenen, ist der Grund für meine positive Bewertung!

[h1]Kleiner Tipp[/h1]

Um Kämpfer ausbilden zu können, müssen die entsprechenden Waffen zuerst gebaut werden. Solltet ihr nur fünf Kämpfer brauchen, braucht ihr keine Rohstoffe verschwenden, um mehr herzustellen. Gefällte Bäume wachsen, zumindest bisher, nicht nach. Beachtet auch, dass ihr einen Arbeiter anweisen müsst einen Ochsen "an sich zu nehmen" um einen Siedler verwenden zu können.

[h1]Review Info![/h1]
[*][b]Testzeit: ca. 3 Stunden[/b][/list]
[*][b]Version: 0.8.0.9[/b][/list]
Anfangs gab es Probleme mit der Wegfindung bei der Ausbildung von Kämpfern. Dieses Problem wurde behoben, weitere Bugs sind mir nicht aufgefallen. Trollskog lief insgesamt flüssig und ohne Abstürze.

[Quote][b]Hat dir diese Review gefallen? Dann zeig es doch mit einem Like oder einem Kommentar. Mehr Reviews wie dieses findest du auf unserer [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/8049466/]Kuratorenseite[/url].[/b][/Quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198030341003', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1567282425}
review:
This project clearly has a long way to go to completion, and I don't think they are hiding that as you can see it in the description. I'd recommend this as an investment toward something that looks like it will be promising. Personally I see strong elements of Age of Empires.

Development looks promising, and the small fix updates are a sign of good development to me as a software developer. I'd rather even see that something is taking longer than expected than nothing at all for 10 months.

My only primary qualm with the game (aside from the expected bugs) would be that something needs to be done about the villager production methods. Carrying materials back and forth through AI pathing that can collide with each other doesn't just create a logistics challenge for engaging gameplay. It creates gross looking bottle necked management requirements. As realistic as it is that a person has to carry a sack of grain back to the bakery, etc, unless you have the AI prioritize methods for mitigating collisions it causes issues. Castle Story is a perfect example of this, FPS loss from clunky AI logic loops that freezes as the game progresses, unit clogging, stutters, crashing, arduous workarounds for the user that limit creative/efficiency freedom of building and unit placement, constant AI bugfixes that may or may not address the issue. Roads exist, one fix could be a pathing that utilizes roads as lanes that require passage in one direction on each side for non-military units, or remove collisions so that friendly non-military units pass through other friendly units. I'm unaware of the plans for the game, but this one thing if not fixed would change my recommendation pretty fast. If realism isn't a concern I would simply make gathering exactly like they do in the tried and true triple A titles, my bet is that a lot of these games don't include physical back and forth exchange for gathering with collision for the sake of making the game cleaner for the user experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995450336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 161, 'last_played': 1567500418}
review:
This game is early access and it shows.

Units get stuck on terrain.
Can't complete Troll son quest even though I rescued him
Villagers constantly need attention to do their job. Pathing needs work.
You can build two towns, but they can't share resources?  At least I couldn't figure out how.
You can only build within the town radius and it seems way too small. I wish it would expand as you build outwards. 
I found an ore mine, but it was too far away from my starting town, so I had to build a second town just to mine from it. 
I really wanted to like this game, but everything just seems so cramped and constricting. 
No tutorial, so you just have to dig in and figure it out. 
this game shows promise, but overall...I just don't see myself returning

author: {'steamid': '76561198055551914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1623561172}
review: Trollskog is a game of very great potential that's dipping it's feet into an untapped genre. It's general flavor will be familiar to anyone who's played old school RTS games like Warcraft 3 or Age of Empires. As of now you can probably experience most of what the game has to offer in a couple of hours time if you rush through it.  Worlds are generated procedurally and seem to be infinite, so you can expand your empire indefinitely as far as I can tell. I'm only up to four towns at the moment, so I'm not sure how a larger game save may effect performance, but I can definitely say that I will have my eye on this game for as long as the developer is adding to it. Open world RTS games should have existed a long time ago.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993429714', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1567869257}
review:

Recommendation: CALL THE EXTERMINATOR.

BUG REPORT: When attempting to corral the first animal I receive, all path finding breaks and the game slowly falls apart till it is unresponsive. Task finder won't come out of hiding behind the app so I must sign out of my computer to clean it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060565285', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1571175609}
review:
It's currently in pretty rough shape.  One of the early quests requires you to gather 4 warriors at some ruins.  The game seems to have a lot of difficulty recognizing when all four warriors are gathered.  If you can eventually get the warriors to trigger the quest to advance, you're told to reclaim a nearby silver mine... but there's no apparent way to do that.  I tried building a new settlement near the mine and the game froze (everything stopped moving) forcing me to quit to desktop.  

If they can iron out these bugs it might be a decent game. 

P.S. They need to let you use WASD keys instead of the arrow keys to move the map.  I don't like playing games with my arms crossed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007180115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1567019956}

author: {'steamid': '76561198100891919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1566993988}
review: It's got good potential, however it feels as if the game needs to be updated (as usual in early access). Way too many bugs where both villagers and npcs gets stuck and just turns back and forth making it impossible to complete quests. Also, you cant scroll to the bottom left for some reason. I couldn't find any real challenges in the game. It felt like i wasnt attacked once while i could still make defensive towers and walls. But then again, maybe it's because i couldnt proceed after the game got stuck?

author: {'steamid': '76561197966594088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 964, 'last_played': 1567879382}

Note that, as of writing, this game is still in early access. Many bugs have been ironed out today, making the game PLAYABLE, but it still has a long way to go to be really exciting.
...but I'm not going to judge it negatively for being in early access - currently it's looking promising.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100974027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1566556597}
review: Fun and very atmospheric city builder with some story elements, there are some small issues with micromanagement, but thats to be expected from EA title. So far it looks like a game that can suck you in, if mellow, city building RTS is your thing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072030526', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1587476267}
review:
For an early access game this is by far one of the better ones I personally have seen and played.

Obviously it's early access and a lot could change and there are some bugs, unit path finding in my experience is hit or miss, sometimes units will get stuck and it would take about 5-6 clicks to unstick the unit from its place. 

However the concept and potential here are very promising and it's well worth supporting if you're into city builders with a fantasy twist. I can see this game being similar to the Stronghold series specifically Stronghold:Legends so if you liked that you'll probably like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025907108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1621623183}
review: Such a cute and rather simplistic game at first view; it gets more complicated the further one progresses. I really enjoy it and you should give it a chance. Also it is just one dev so that was some hard work. He/she really listens to people's opinions! Looking forward to updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040052230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1566766403}
review: Buggy to the point of unusable. Developer response to review unsatisfactory. After trying for 4 hours to get game to work Steam won't refund. Wasted $11.99
developer_response:
I'll admit, there were more bugs and problems in the early access launch than I expected.
There's a lot of promises I could make and words I could say about the future of this game... But I'd rather show you, instead. 
I hope, when the time comes, you'll give the game another try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014323496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1641308950}
review:
This game is still in its pretty early stages, so don't expect everything to be working smoothly quite yet. That said, I've played much worse for a first Steam release, feels like with a couple of patches the basics should be playable. Would recommend waiting a little bit unless you enjoy bug reporting.

The concept is really nice and I'm looking forward to being able to play more, right now the big deal breaker is that loading saved games doesn't work, so I haven't been able to play for so long.

Anyway, Early Access points aside, it's quite a cute game, very casual and relaxed. It's fairly straightforward in terms of city building, and seems to encourage making multiple small settlements around the map instead of one megalopolis. There appear to be some elements of questing, and the maps are very big (not sure if infinite?), so you can just kinda expand as much as you want and explore the surroundings.

I will definitely come back to this once the major issues have been fixed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198097288011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1680071461}
review:
This is one of those enchanting games that appears to be first rate awesome. It is fun to play and has great ambiance.  Unfortunately, it is also one of those games that has game ending bugs. 
I will surely check up on it later. But for now it is basically a really cool unplayable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061620203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1567046833}
review:
I'll divide this up as things I like and dislike about the game, and finally things that need to change. A disclaimer is I love city builders, especially with Fantasy styles and folklore in them such as this one. It also reminds me of a more free form version of Northgard.

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]The Good[/th]
        [th]Why?[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Art style is amazing.[/td]
        [td]the mixture of 2D art and the 3D shapes and art contrasting, such as with buildings vs fields and bushes gives the game an interesting and fun art style, especially with such simple details without overwhelming the player when focusing on different objectives at a time..[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Controls[/td]
        [td]The controls feel very standard to most RTS's which to me makes it feel easier in order to move to this from another game, though there are a few things that need to be adjusted.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]The Tutorial[/td]
        [td]The game gets you into its systems and how to play very quickly, and doesn't make the game feel overly complicated. It could use a couple more fine details in certain parts of the tutorial, but it's trial and error is pretty simple and easy to get around for getting started.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]The Bad[/th]
        [th]Why?[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td] Some buildings are glitched[/td]
        [td] Occasionally some of the buildings that produce units do not allow you to take those units outside of the buildings area, leaving them stuck inside the building. I've used workarounds like selling the building and rebuilding to correct it, but that should be an issue that is fixable by extending the unit's "non-collision" till it is fully outside.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Unit Pathing[/td]
        [td]Unit's path oddly sometimes and do not interact with buildings when told to click on them on certain occasions, such as dropping off a club at the barracks. Also, sometimes when interacting with a moving entity (enemies or livestock) they will occasionally stutter constantly between "moving" and "action" as if the moving entity suddenly caused them to spasm out.[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Things that need to be fixed:
[list]
[*]Barracks soldiers cannot move outside the barracks after being spawned
[*]Resources do not get delivered when clicking on the building in the villagers window
[*]villagers stutter step when being directed to a job occasionally
[*]Barracks is very hard to interact with for villagers
[/list]

I am really excited to see how this game improves going forward, and I hope it picks up some steam. It has been very fun in what I played at the time of writing this, I plan on playing some more when I wake up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154628252', 'num_games_owned': 653, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 4166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4130, 'last_played': 1567366404}
review:
I love citybuilders, and I love fantasy and folktales, so when the developer asked me if I wanted to try this game, I had to say: Ï never heard of it, let me look it up...".

So I did look it up, and I liked what I saw. I played it, and saw that this game has some great potential! If you like city builders, love the old-school fantasy city builders like Warcraft then go ahead and pick it up. 

Fair warning! This game is still in development, has some bugs and is still light on the gameplay! One bug is not shutting down, hence it shows me having played the game for 68 hours xD!

If you want to see some gameplay footage, check out my video! If you like the video, subscribe for more!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7CCGJIWTkS4

author: {'steamid': '76561198017816168', 'num_games_owned': 563, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1566321642}
review:
Hmm, it might be fun and has promise, but its riddled with bugs, some gamebreaking. The save files gets corrupted constantly, and Ive tried 3 times now but the game crashes after about 20 minutes. When trying to load the file the game crashes again.

My recommendation: Come back in 2 weeks when the game has been patched. I will change my review when they do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977482675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1611097192}
review: Bueno ahora que a salido finalmente en Steam es hora de hacer un pequeño comentario respecto a este juego, he sido tester de este juego durante unos 2 o 3 años, este juego para mi gusto tiene un potencial enorme y a dia de hoy me gusta mucho el camino por el que va, es un juego echo por una sola persona, y el trabajo que esta realizando es espectacular, he visto incontables cambios en este juego desde el inicio de su desarrollo, y cada vez va a mejor, actualmente su contenido no es muy amplio te da para unas horas de diversion, pero si te gustan los RTS, gestionar pueblos o ciudades, hacer misiones por un amplio mundo (yo aun no he descubierto si tiene limite, ya que me he centrado mas en encontrar todos los bugs posibles y ayudar dando ideas) y el folklore sueco, este juego te va a gustar mucho, actualmente solo tiene para un solo jugador, pero su desarrollador a comentado que una de las cosas que le gustaria implementar mas adelante es multijugador, cosa que en este juego desde mi punto de vista tiene que ser increible, el futuro de este juego es prometedor y tambien se plantea que se le podrian hacer mods en un futuro, asi que yo que quereis que os diga, voy a seguir apoyando al desarrollador de este juego "mata", y su gran proyecto, espero que se forme una buena comunidad en este juego y que entre todos le ayudemos a mejorar el juego, tanto encontrando bugs (que tiene es normal) y dando nuevas ideas, espero que os sirva aun que no sea muy detallado, ya que simplemente expreso mi admiracion por el trabajo que esta haciendo su desarrollador y el camino tan increible que esta tomando el juego, saludos. ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198019696881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1676265429}
review:
[h1]Trollskog - A real-time strategy game based on Swedish folklore with some 4x elements[/h1]
[b]Disclaimer: I was and still is a closed alpha tester of this game[/b]
A game made by mostly one guy named Mata. Trollskog may have little content with only 2 to 3 hours, but it's potential is huge.
Also the content that is available in the 8/19/2019 version is very stable and captures the vision of how this game functions. I will continue updating my review based on content that were major to the game and the final release version. 

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Aspect[/th]
        [th]Rating[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]The game feels responsive and right because the units obey you immediately and follow their path right.. sometimes. Also it's possible to micro by pulling in wounded units and let the healthy ones fights with the enemies until the wounded units are healed up. Also some controls and UI are not there like seeing a production queue, no visual control group icons, pressing the control group hotkey does not bring the camera to the location of said control group, which should be standard, and there is only one faction and it's still being in a work in progress. I really hope for a Trolls faction or race.[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphics[/td]
        [td]The visuals of Trollskog are simple, and minimalist, but it makes it clear and easy to read the units in the game. Also the game oozes and tells the great stories and tales of Sweden because of the trolls and myling models and look[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Audio[/td]
        [td]The sounds and music are okay at best. It doesn't have the badass songs of the Witcher, but hopefully this field will be improved in the Early Access[/td]
    [/tr]
[tr]
[td]Theme[/td]
[td] The theme and look of Trollskog is inspired by the smaller cousin of Norse Mythology - Swedish folklore. While The most iconic trolls are in there, I wish for more variety of awesome swedish creatures in this game since fighting bandits and mylings will be tiring. 

[b] Conclusion [/b]
Right now, the game is worth to buy if you want to see the full potential of a RTS with some 4X elements, also it's just $12 so it's cheap to get. It's fun for a few hours, but right now I think the player would not be serious enough to play this game for like over 100 hours. But it's good for what it is now. but if you don't like the low amount of content in this game then I understand. But for me, Trollskog is definitely gonna be a great ride to see it's final version. I am pretty excited for it's future

Edit: How do I get the Conclusion section out of the table?

2nd Edit: This game have not received any updates for a while now. I recommend you not to buy this game since the developer have a job that takes up most of their attention, rather then developing Trollskog.
